reviews.review:
El juego como concepto no es malo. La idea de hacer un videojuego basado en el clÃ¡sico subgÃ©nero "Slasher" de los 90 donde un grupo de personas que tienen "X" conexiÃ³n son perseguidos por algÃºn ente maligno, psicÃ³pata o villano de turno. Donde el objetivo principal de este grupo de cuatro personas es escapar de las garras del antagonista de turno, cuyo objetivo es terminar con la vida de estos.
Uno pensarÃ­a como jugador que este juego tendrÃ­a un futuro brillante por delante siendo entretenido y manteniendo cierto equilibrio entre asesinos y supervivientes para que todos puedan disfrutar a la par de la experiencia y es justo ahÃ­ donde el juego se empieza a caer a pedazos, esto se debe a que al existir un nulo equilibrio entre partidas lleva a los supervivientes a abusar de ciertas perks (Habilidades del juego, que funcionan como pasivas y activas) sumado a la capacidad de poner accesorios (Items que pueden modificar ciertos valores del juego, tales como aumentar la suerte o cambiar las probabilidades de apariciÃ³n de un mapa entre otras cosas) y objetos (Herramientas utilizables tales como, botiquines, linternas, cajas de herramientas, etc...) lo que lleva a muchos asesinos a frustrarse al solamente poder empatar 3 de 10 partidas (es decir que solo pueden matar a la mitad de los supervivientes) perder 5 de 10 partidas y ganar a penas 2 partidas de 10, debido a esto lleva a malas practicas por parte de los jugadores asesinos que los lleva a jugar de una manera nada agradable para todos los jugadores de la partida, un ejemplo claro es cuando cuelgan a un superviviente teniendo los 5  generadores apagados y en vez de ir a buscar al resto de supervivientes lo que le quita una de sus 3 vidas para poder seguir disfrutando de la experiencia se quedan a una distancia cercana a ellos y los fichan como objetivos primarios sin sentido o otras veces esto se debe al BM (Bad manners) lo que puede llegar a molestar a muchos asesinos que incurren en estas practicas. Por otro lado otro problema prioritario que tiene el juego respecto a los asesinos es que los supervivientes solo tienen un objetivo prioritario inamovible el cual es reparar los generadores y como objetivo secundario el destruir totems que les da mas puntaje y algunos que albergan perks de los asesinos, mientras que el objetivo principal del asesino es matar a los supervivientes con persecuciones que pueden durar un aproximado de 1 minuto a 2 minutos de solamente 1 superviviente a la vez lo que deja los generadores totalmente o parcialmente descubiertos el tiempo suficiente para que los terminen lo cual vuelve el rol de asesino demasiado complicado de forma innecesaria. El problema mÃ¡s grande que tiene en la actualidad el juego es la escasez  de objetivos de los supervivientes, ya que existe una cantidad de jugadores no despreciable que abandonan el juego debido a la corta duraciÃ³n de las partidas. En los aspectos mÃ¡s tÃ©cnicos del juego, cada vez que exista una adiciÃ³n de contenido al juego siempre existen los errores que pueden presentarse, sin embargo es imperdonable que despuÃ©s de meses de la apariciÃ³n de estos, no se haga ni un solo intento por arreglarlos. Un claro ejemplo es la pasiva de juego de nemesis cuyo funcionamiento consiste en la generaciÃ³n de zombies alrededor del mapa para que el hagan mÃ¡s complicado el juego a los supervivientes, mecÃ¡nica que funciona solamente 1 de cada 8 partidas entre otras cosas de distintos killers. Otro problema grave que tiene el juego es la inexistencia de un sistema de ranking real dentro del juego junto a su correspondiente sistema de recompensas, si bien existe una especie de "Ranking" es totalmente ineficiente especialmente al degradar a los jugadores del rango mÃ¡ximo del juego al mÃ¡s bajo, con una recompensa mÃ¡xima de 250000 BP  lo que es una burla al usuario tanto de superviviente como de killer teniendo en cuenta que para volver a llegar a sus rangos ya habrÃ¡n recolectado un aproximado de 5 millones de BP. Si los creadores del juego no se ponen manos a la obra con este juego y le empiezan a poner un poco de esfuerzo terminara inevitablemente olvidado, quizÃ¡s sea el momento de dejar de poner mÃ¡s cosmeticos y dedicarse a lo que conlleva el juego (mecÃ¡nicas, ambiente, perks, accesorios, entro todo lo que se ha mencionado)
Baba mesisch dieses gerÃ¤usch wenn sie schreien

Dead by Daylight is a confusing game that is definitely worth your money, especially on sale. for the purposes of review, i will split this game experience into two groups; the first 20 hours, and after.

The First 20 Hours: The time for Rollplay and Powerfantasy. during this time, new players will be learning the game and going up against unskilled players.the initial simplicity of the game ensures that both sides will have little trouble understanding how to play and what to do. during this time, the horror aesthetic is in full force.

For survivors, very little information is known about the maps or locations of generators, so you feel quite lost in the maps, in a good way. You never know what you're going to see around the next corner, and it helps build tension. Killers are terrifying. Running and hiding from them is tense and fun. the game is less about winning overall, and more just escaping the killer in that moment. Its not about whether you escape or not, but that the fantasy is fulfilled.

As for the killer, living out the power fantasy of becoming a slasher villain is fully realized, you feel powerful, and the power dynamic ensures that survivors will respect that power, and will run at the sight of you. You don't need to trouble yourself with the intricacies of all of the games systems, like Teachable Perks, Killer Addons, and in-game tech, like mindgames. Again, it is less about killing all the survivors, and more about fulfilling the fantasy as a powerful killer, as long as you do some damage, and kill at least a couple survivors per trial, most players would have a good time.


After 20 Hours: The fantasy gives way to the win condition, After around 10 hours or so, the fantasy starts to diminish, and the player begins to consider what the win condition is in the game. for survivors, it is simple: escape. for killers, this is a bit more murky. there are many things that can be considered a win: be it kill all 4 survivors, or get iridescent  emblems in all 4 categories, or something more arbitrary that the player has set for themselves. By 20 hours, this has completely overtaken the rollplay aspect, and it is after this that the real Dead by Daylight emerges, along with all of its problems.

Gameplay: the goal of all survivors is to complete all 5 generators, that's a given, but the most efficient way to do that is to maximize chase time for the killer, for 1 survivor at a time, and give the other 3 survivors all the time they need to complete the generators. players over time have gotten ruthlessly efficient at using resources in the map to avoid being downed. The correct way to play the game as survivor, is to run to any position in the game that has a pallet, (something a survivor can drop on the killer to stun them) then to waste as much time as possible before safely dropping the pallet to avoid being hit by the killer. this is known as "Looping," and it is not conducive to the power fantasy at all, and is the major reason the fantasy dissipates so quickly. it forces the killer to run round a few rocks in a circle chasing the survivor, like in a merry-go-round, before the survivor drops the pallet and wait for the killer to  break it, then run to the next area with a pallet. the more complicated versions of this are areas with other things the survivors can use to avoid the killer, like windows. these area's are known as "tiles." most new players will find this playstyle frustrating, and it is where i would recommend quitting the game, as overcoming this obstacle will require a complete shift in playstyle, and in how you look at the game

The next phase of the game revolves around Looping, Mindgames, and Map Pressure. The game here is a mixed bag, and it is for 1 huge reason; Balance. The game has over a dozen killers, all with their own strengths and weaknesses, and this comes with many problems. the survivor has a static power cap, while the killers are all different, and because the maps also vary in size and complexity, there will always be scenarios where one side has the advantage, be it big or small. This leads to a lot of toxicity. survivors and killers will berate each opposing side in the post game lobby for all sorts of things, (using strong addons, using an unfair combination of perks, using a map offering, for playing a certain killer that is too strong, all sorts). most games have an overpowered character or strategy, but because this game is never in equilibrium, players will always be mad at the other side for having an advantage. this balance could be remedied by the developers, at lest to an extent, but they seem either unwilling or unable to take the time to balance and tweak the game at a reasonable rate, leading to a drip feed of balance changes that are far outpaced by the amount of new killers, perks, and maps being added to the game, leading to a game that can never be balanced.

Verdict: It is because of this that i  would recommend stopping at this point, as the game will never be in a state where you can feel as though your skill alone will decide games, or that it is even the biggest factor. what matters most is that you get a good map, are playing a powerful killer, and have good addons. this will honesty have you win 90% of your games or more, and it isn't satisfying. but attempting to get better also isn't  satisfying, because you know that other players will be using these things to win, leading to frustration, and toxic behavior. Id still recommend it because even if you don't enjoy what the endgame is, you still have 10-20 hours of fun on offer, especially with friends.  Play till you start feeling frustrated, then uninstall.

do not camp, but also do not be salty when a killer is simply good, killers are faster then you  because they are meant to be a force of nature your game is based around they are the match in a sense if they are really good you are play a legendary level of difficulty as a level 1 noob, with the ranking system this is avoid but your meant to run into the sometimes great killer, sometimes brand new killer, the research of perks you want is vital to the fun of your DbD experience if you are playing with super low level low tier perks do not expect to do well ( talking to you territorial imperative for god sakes snare or expose a survivor, make someone have to go get them and then it does not snare for like 20 seconds, make it take 2 seconds to activate and just be a short survivor action) but overall the game is great, the randomization of the tiles and map variety has grown over the years to make multiple high threat killers a reality and the low tier ones are still fun to play even if your not going to be 4 killing highly skilled, communicate heavy groups, with a really good survivor being able to hold off a killer for minutes at a time, even in some medium to high level games your game night can vary, overall if the community stays overall positive its possible dbd can continue its reign as the ultimate 1v4 horror survival game in my personal opinion
es un gran juego y te lo pasaras muy bien y mejor con amigos ya que se cagaran de risa la verdad me gusta mucho el juego muy recomendado y si te das el lujo de comprarlo te lo pasaras genial xd :)

The new ranking system isn't great, but don't let that distract you from how good this game is. It is so very unique, and it's truly a one of a kind experience. If you get the chance to catch this game on sale definitely pick it up. You will have no problems sinking plenty of time into it. Whether you play killer or survivor, you will enjoy this awesome piece of multiplayer game play.
